TopicTitle: Is anyone ever going to update the ISA Mapsat plugin for .21?

Articles.Content: Title says it all.
ISA is unlicensed and the creator is inactive, so it cannot be updated. It'd be a good idea for someone to create a new mod to replace it.

Innsewerants shows up with similar frequency to the full moon, he'll probably be back.

In the mean time, competition profits all involved. We get more, and the makers get to see how differing approaches work out.

I actually tried to track down some contact info for Innsewerants with some e-stalking. But despite the fact that he freely gives away his real name and date of birth in several places, and in one place his location, I can't find anything on him. He doesn't seem to be in the phone book, or on Facebook and the like.

I am forced to conclude Innsewerants is currently on a deep cover mission in South America, hunting down Bolivian drug lords.

It is still working fine for me in .21

I've currently mapped 3 things with no problems.

No! A license is permission by the copyright holder to do things which, ordinarily, he has the exclusive right to. No license means he reserves these rights solely for himself. With no license, you can only do what the law considers "fair use".

Regardless of what degree of sarcasm your text fails to convey, the legal matter is that ISA is All Rights Reserved, you do not have the right to do anything with his code without a document stating otherwise, and Squad will respect that because if they don't it places them in legal jeopardy.

You cannot do anything with his code beyond download it, view it, and play it. You cannot use his code but you are allowed to learn from it. You cannot distribute his code or any derivative works, you are not permitted to 'fork' ISA, though there exists a gray area on patches composed of entirely new code (your own work, maybe), but I believe Squad has said no to them.

Also ISA does work with KSP 0.20.x and 0.21.x, so even if that were the case your claim would be unfounded.

As far as I know, ISA works perfectly fine for .21 and Innsewerants is planning to keep updating it.

There are currently two versions in circulation- the (ultra-dev) 4x, and the release 3x. 3x does not work in 0.21, but 4x does as it was intended to be released for 0.21.

At this point in time Insewwerants has not given anyone permission to distribute modified versions of it. Although it probably will see a release from him in the not so distant future, he is currently having difficulties with reality taking away from his time available to work on it.

You must be patient with him. Life gets the best of him at times, and having been through similar conditions myself I can say it would be highly depressing to check in on a rare visit and see people complaining about the lack of updates when he just plain hasn't the time to make them.

He will be back, and when he does mapsat will come back with him.

Until then the only thing you can really do is fix it yourself and share your notes on how- but do not distribute modifications of his source code or binaries generated from it. At best you could probably get away with distributing code snippets you've made along with instructions on how to patch his code with them, that way people can build their own fixed copies without actually distributing his source.

Anyway, is there any benefit from using several MapSat dishes, or I can just use one? Is the dish orientation a significant factor? Last night, before I went to bed, I let it scan Eve and now I've got a complete scan ready.
No you only need one dish, and the only parameter that is important is the altitude of your orbit , if you are high the scan will have less resolution ( but you cover a bigger area)
